metadata.title: CVE-2016-2853 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - low
metadata.description:
The aufs module for the Linux kernel 3.x and 4.x does not properly restrictthe mount namespace, which allows local users to gain privileges bymounting an aufs filesystem on top of a FUSE filesystem, and then executinga crafted setuid program.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-2853` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-222-generic - 4.4.0-222.255~14.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-222-generic - 4.4.0-222.255~14.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-222-lowlatency - 4.4.0-222.255~14.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1102-aws - 4.4.0-1102.107
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'was needs-triage ESM criteria').
linux-goldfish: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
linux-grouper: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.

linux-manta: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
linux-flo: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
linux-lts-utopic: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-lts-vivid: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
linux-lts-wily: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-lts-xenial package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-222.255~14.04.1').
linux-aws package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1102.107').
